articles.title: New moon? Scientists claim the Earth’s satellite may have a ‘dead ringer’ - The Guardian
articles.description: An asteroid hidden behind Mars has been found to closely resemble our moon. Is is a fragment that broke off billions of years ago?
articles.content:
Name: (101429) 1998 VF31 (AKA: the Moons Sister).
Age: 4.5bn years, give or take.
Appearance: Lunar.
Twinned with: The moon.
